triggers.title: Timer Trigger
triggers.description: This trigger node fires the workflow at specified intervals or at a specific time.

fireOnStart.description: Fire the trigger immediately when the workflow starts

scheduleType.description: Choose between interval-based or specific time scheduling

schedule.description: Select the interval for the timer

specificTime.description: Select the specific time to run the trigger

specificDays.description: Select the days to run the trigger at the specific time

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the trigger fired

triggers.title: Webhook Listener
triggers.description: This trigger node listens for incoming webhook requests and triggers the workflow when a request is received.

webhookUrl.description: The unique webhook URL for this workflow

authToken.description: Authentication token for Bearer or Webhook authentication

responseMode.description: Whether to return 200 OK immediately or wait for the workflow to complete and return the result

responseBody.description: Template for the response body. You can use variables from the workflow steps (e.g. {{stepName.output}}).

responseContentType.description: Content-Type header for the response (e.g. application/json)

method.description: The HTTP method of the received request

headers.description: The headers of the incoming request

body.description: The body of the incoming request

query.description: The query parameters of the incoming request

params.description: The route parameters of the incoming request

triggers.title: Receive Email
triggers.description: This trigger node listens for incoming emails and triggers the workflow when a new email is received. Returns the received email details like from address, subject, body, etc.

emailConfig.description: Choose between built-in email or custom IMAP settings

emailAddress.description: The email address to monitor for incoming emails

subject.description: The subject of the received email

body.description: The body content of the received email

attachments.description: An array of attachment objects, if any

actions.title: AI LLM Call
actions.description: This action node uses AI models for text generation, vision analysis, and image generation. Supports multiple providers including OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, and Grok.

mode.description: Choose the operation mode: generate text, analyze images, or create images

prompt.description: The input prompt or text for the LLM

visionPrompt.description: Question or instruction about the image(s)

imagePrompt.description: Describe the image you want to generate

imageOperation.description: Type of image operation (only OpenAI supports Edit/Variation)

referenceImage.description: Base64 image for editing or creating variations (OpenAI only)

numberOfImages.description: Number of images to generate (1-10, OpenAI/Grok only)

useGoogleSearch.description: Ground generation with real-time Google Search data (Gemini only)

responseFormat.description: Response format: URL or base64 JSON (OpenAI/Grok only)

maxTokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate

temperature.description: Controls randomness in the output (0.0 to 1.0)

parseJson.description: Parse the generated text as JSON

generatedText.description: The text generated by the LLM

tokenCount.description: The number of tokens in the generated text

generatedImages.description: Array of generated images (URLs or base64 data)

firstImage.description: The first generated image (convenience field for single image access)

error.description: Error message if the operation failed

actions.title: Agent Chat
actions.description: Chat with an AI agent from your agent library. Select an agent and send messages to interact with it within your workflow.

agentId.description: Select the agent to chat with

message.description: The message to send to the agent

agentId.description: The ID of the agent that responded

toolExecutions.description: Array of tools executed by the agent with their inputs and outputs

toolsUsed.description: Number of tools used by the agent

error.description: Error message if the chat failed

actions.title: Custom API Request
actions.description: This action node makes a custom API request to any endpoint with configurable method, headers, and authentication.

url.description: The URL of the API endpoint

method.description: The HTTP method for the request

headers.description: Optional headers for the request. e.g., {"Content-Type": "application/json"}

body.description: Optional data to send with the request. Often JSON for APIs, but could be other formats depending on the API requirements.

success.description: Indicates whether the API request was successful

status.description: The HTTP status code of the response

result.description: The data returned by the API

headers.description: The headers of the API response

error.description: Error message if the API request failed

actions.title: SLOP Connector
actions.description: Connect to any SLOP-compatible API endpoints

baseUrl.description: Base URL of the SLOP API (e.g., https://api.example.com)

authToken.description: Authentication token (if required by the SLOP API)

resourceId.description: ID of the specific resource to access

toolId.description: ID of the specific tool to use

payload.description: JSON payload to send with the request

result.description: The result data from the SLOP endpoint

error.description: Error message if the request failed

status.description: HTTP status code of the response

actions.title: MCP Client
actions.description: Connect to MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers. Automatically discovers servers from mcp.json. WORKFLOW: 1) List Servers to see available MCPs, 2) Get Server Capabilities to see what tools/resources a server offers, 3) Use Server to call those tools/resources.

operation.description: REQUIRED WORKFLOW: First use 'List Servers' to see available MCPs, then 'Get Server Capabilities' to see what a specific server offers (tools/resources/prompts), finally 'Use Server' to call those capabilities. 'Connect to Remote URL' connects directly to a remote MCP server via URL. 'Close Connection' resets a specific server connection. 'Close All Connections' resets all server connections.

serverUrl.description: Remote MCP server URL (e.g., https://api.githubcopilot.com/mcp/, https://mcp.notion.com/mcp, https://mcp.sentry.dev/sse, https://mcp.linear.app/sse)

authToken.description: Optional Bearer token for authentication (if required by the remote server)

serverName.description: Name of the MCP server (from the List Servers output). Example: chrome-devtools, local-example-server

action.description: The action to perform on the MCP server

toolName.description: Name of the tool to call (from the server's tools list)

toolArgs.description: JSON STRING of arguments for the tool. Must be a valid JSON string, not an object. Example: "{\"query\": \"hello\", \"limit\": 10}"

resourceUri.description: URI of the resource (from the server's resources list). Example: file:///path/to/file.txt

promptName.description: Name of the prompt to retrieve (from the server's prompts list)

promptArgs.description: JSON object of arguments for the prompt template. Example: {"name": "John", "topic": "AI"}

servers.description: List of available MCP servers (for List Servers operation)

count.description: Number of available servers (for List Servers operation)

serverName.description: Name of the server (for Get Server Capabilities operation)

capabilities.description: Server capabilities including tools, resources, and prompts arrays (for Get Server Capabilities operation)

toolCount.description: Number of tools available (for Get Server Capabilities operation)

resourceCount.description: Number of resources available (for Get Server Capabilities operation)

promptCount.description: Number of prompts available (for Get Server Capabilities operation)

result.description: The result of the action (for Use Server operation)

serverInfo.description: Server information including version and capabilities

error.description: Error message if the operation failed

actions.title: Browser Agent
actions.description: Executes instructions using Browser Use to run browser automation tasks.

instructions.description: Instructions for the browser automation task.

gifPath.description: Path or URL to the generated GIF

error.description: Error message if the tool fails

actions.title: Send Email
actions.description: This action node sends an email to a specified recipient with a customizable subject and body.

body.description: The body content of the email

isHtml.description: Whether the body content is HTML

success.description: Indicates whether the email was sent successfully

content.description: The content of the sent email

messageId.description: The unique message ID of the sent email

serverResponse.description: Server response details including status, statusText, data, and headers

error.description: Error message if the email sending failed

actions.title: Text to Speech
actions.description: Converts text to speech using OpenAI's TTS API.

text.description: The text to convert to speech (max 4096 characters)

voice.description: The voice to use for the speech

speed.description: The speed of the generated audio (0.25 to 4.0)

result.description: The result of the action, varies based on the action performed

error.description: Error message if the action failed

actions.title: Web Scrape
actions.description: Scrapes a URL to extract main text content, all links, AND all code snippets on the page. Use the returned `links` array for recursive research and `codeContent` to build documentation.

textContent.description: The main text content extracted from the page

links.description: Array of all links found on the page

codeContent.description: All code snippets found on the page

error.description: Error message if the scraping failed

actions.title: Web Search
actions.description: This action node performs a web search using the AGNT provided Google Custom Search API and returns the top results.

searchQuery.description: The search query to be executed

numResults.description: The number of results to return (default: 5)

results.description: An array of search result objects

error.description: Error message if the search failed

utilities.title: Text Label
utilities.description: This utility node displays a text label in the workflow, providing additional context or information.

utilities.title: Counter
utilities.description: Increments a counter each time it is executed.

initialValue.description: The initial value of the counter

utilities.title: Database Operation
utilities.description: This utility node performs database operations on user-specific data.

operation.description: The type of database operation to perform

tableName.description: The name of the virtual table to operate on

columns.description: Comma-separated list of columns (for SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE)

condition.description: WHERE clause for the operation (for SELECT, UPDATE, DELETE)

values.description: Comma-separated list of values (for INSERT, UPDATE)

success.description: Indicates whether the database operation was successful

result.description: The data returned by the database operation (for SELECT)

affectedRows.description: The number of rows affected by the operation (for INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE)

error.description: Error message if the database operation failed

utilities.title: Data Transformer
utilities.description: This utility node allows you to transform and manipulate data using common transformation functions.

input.description: The input data to be transformed

error.description: Error message if the transformation failed

utilities.title: Execute Javascript
utilities.description: This utility node allows you to execute custom JavaScript code within the workflow, enabling advanced logic and data transformations.

result.description: The result of the JavaScript code execution

error.description: Error message if the code execution failed

utilities.title: Execute Python
utilities.description: This utility node allows you to execute custom Python code within the workflow, enabling advanced logic and data transformations.

result.description: The result of the Python code execution

error.description: Error message if the code execution failed

utilities.title: File System Operation
utilities.description: This utility node performs file system operations within a specified root directory.

rootDirectory.description: The root directory for file system operations

operation.description: The type of file system operation to perform

path.description: The relative path for the file or directory

content.description: The content to write or append to the file (for writeFile and appendFile operations)

success.description: Indicates whether the file system operation was successful

result.description: The result of the operation (file content for readFile, execution output for executeFile, list of files for listFiles, or operation status for writeFile and appendFile)

error.description: Error message if the file system operation failed

utilities.title: Random Number
utilities.description: Generates a random number within a specified range.

widgets.title: Media Preview
widgets.description: Advanced media preview tool that displays images or videos from URLs, base64 data, or streaming platforms. Automatically detects media types, extracts metadata (dimensions, file size), and processes base64 data with enhanced validation and optimization.

mediaSource.description: Media URL, base64 data (with or without data URI prefix), or blob URL. Supports images (jpg, png, gif, webp, bmp, svg), videos (mp4, webm, mov, avi, mkv, wmv), and streaming URLs (YouTube, Vimeo, etc.). Automatically detects format from magic bytes for raw base64.

success.description: Whether the media was successfully processed

originalUrl.description: The original media URL before processing

base64Data.description: Full data URI with prefix (data:image/jpeg;base64,abc123...) - ready for HTML display

metadata.description: Extracted media metadata including dimensions, format, file size, and processing info

fileSize.description: File size in bytes (calculated for base64 data, fetched for URLs)

error.description: Error message if media processing failed

widgets.title: HTML Preview
widgets.description: Renders HTML content in a sandboxed preview window. Supports raw HTML strings, URLs, base64-encoded HTML, and drag & drop .html files. Automatically extracts metadata about scripts, styles, and external resources.

htmlSource.description: HTML content to preview. Can be raw HTML string, URL to fetch HTML from, base64-encoded HTML (data:text/html;base64,...), or blob URL. Supports drag & drop of .html files.

sandboxMode.description: Security sandbox level: Strict (blocks all scripts), Allow Scripts (allows scripts but blocks inline event handlers), Full Access (no restrictions)

success.description: Whether the HTML was successfully processed

htmlContent.description: The processed HTML content ready for rendering

metadata.description: Extracted HTML metadata including character count, script/style detection, external resources, and source type

error.description: Error message if HTML processing failed

widgets.title: Code Preview
widgets.description: Displays syntax-highlighted code with language detection. Supports drag & drop of code files and auto-detects programming language from file extensions.

codeSource.description: Code content to display. Supports drag & drop of code files (.js, .py, .java, .html, .css, etc.)

success.description: Whether the code was successfully processed

language.description: The detected or specified programming language

metadata.description: Code metadata including line count, complexity, and detected features (functions, classes, comments)

error.description: Error message if code processing failed

widgets.title: PDF Preview
widgets.description: Displays PDF documents with download capability. Supports URLs, blob URLs, and base64-encoded PDFs up to 20MB.

pdfSource.description: PDF source. Can be URL, blob URL, or base64 data (data:application/pdf;base64,...). Supports drag & drop of .pdf files.

success.description: Whether the PDF was successfully processed

pdfUrl.description: The PDF URL ready for rendering

metadata.description: PDF metadata including source type, file size, and page count (when available)

error.description: Error message if PDF processing failed

widgets.title: Audio Preview
widgets.description: Audio player with waveform visualization. Supports MP3, WAV, OGG, WebM, AAC, and M4A formats up to 10MB.

audioSource.description: Audio source. Can be URL, blob URL, or base64 data (data:audio/...). Supports drag & drop of audio files.

success.description: Whether the audio was successfully processed

audioUrl.description: The audio URL ready for playback

metadata.description: Audio metadata including source type, file size, duration, format, bitrate, and sample rate (when available)

error.description: Error message if audio processing failed

widgets.title: Markdown Preview
widgets.description: Renders markdown content with preview/source toggle. Supports headers, bold, italic, links, code blocks, inline code, and lists.

markdownSource.description: Markdown content to render. Supports drag & drop of .md files.

success.description: Whether the markdown was successfully processed

metadata.description: Markdown metadata including line count, word count, and detected features (headers, links, images, code blocks, tables, lists)

error.description: Error message if markdown processing failed

widgets.title: Chart Preview
widgets.description: Data visualization with multiple chart types (bar, line, pie, doughnut, radar). Supports JSON and CSV data formats.

chartData.description: Chart data in JSON or CSV format. JSON format: {"labels": [...], "datasets": [{"label": "...", "data": [...]}]}. Supports drag & drop of .json and .csv files.

success.description: Whether the chart data was successfully processed

chartData.description: The parsed and formatted chart data

metadata.description: Chart metadata including data point count, dataset count, value range, total, and average

error.description: Error message if chart processing failed

controls.title: Delay
controls.description: This control node introduces a delay in the workflow execution.

duration.description: The duration of the delay in milliseconds

unit.description: The unit of time for the delay duration

delayedUntil.description: The timestamp when the delay will end

controls.title: For Loop
controls.description: Executes a set of actions repeatedly for a specified number of iterations or over a list of items.

loopType.description: The type of loop to execute

initialValue.description: The initial value for the iteration counter

start.description: The starting value for range-based loops

end.description: The ending value (exclusive) for range-based loops

step.description: The step value for range-based loops

list.description: Comma-separated list of items to iterate over

actions.description: Comma-separated list of action node IDs to execute in each iteration

iterations.description: The total number of iterations executed

results.description: An array of results from each iteration

controls.title: Parallel Execution
controls.description: This control node executes multiple tasks in parallel.

tasks.description: Comma-separated list of node ids to be executed in parallel (e.g., 'webSearch, sendEmail'). Names are case-insensitive and spaces are ignored.

results.description: Array of results from parallel execution

controls.title: Run Workflow
controls.description: This action node executes another complete workflow within the current workflow.

workflowId.description: The ID of the workflow to run

inputData.description: JSON object containing input data for the sub-workflow

waitForCompletion.description: Wait for the sub-workflow to complete before continuing

success.description: Indicates whether the sub-workflow execution was successful

subWorkflowCompleted.description: Indicates whether the sub-workflow has completed execution

outputs.description: The output data from the executed sub-workflow

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during sub-workflow execution

controls.title: Stop Workflow
controls.description: This control node stops the workflow execution.

stopped.description: Indicates whether the workflow was stopped

reason.description: The reason provided for stopping the workflow
